intro: Relbunium, commonly known as the common relbunium, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound umbels of small, white or greenish flowers. The leaves are typically pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is native to various regions in Europe and Asia, often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Relbunium species are valued for their medicinal properties and are used in traditional herbal remedies.
